page.title: 08Farming 3: Fertilization
page.content: The fields are rotated. For seven years they are used for crops and then for four years it is sown with grass for pasture so that the land is never exhausted. There is a restriction on the use of nitrogen, other fertilizers and pesticides because this is also a water catchment area. This rule was put forward by the Eastbourne Corporation who own all of the land. To cover the five hundred acres of the average farm, in this area, a combine harvester, hay balers and at least five tractors are necessary. The farmer also has to employ various people to work on the farm; for example, two full time and one part time workers are employed at Bullockdown Farm, though during the harvest more people are usually required.
